--- title: "Wrap-up + Shiny" subtitle: "Lecture 25" date: "April 23, 2024" format: revealjs: footer: "[üîó sta199-s24.github.io](https://sta199-s24.github.io/)  ¬∑  [‚ùì Ask on Ed](https://edstem.org/us/courses/50730)" --- # Warm up ## While you wait for class to begin... ::: question Take the time to fill out course and TA evaluations! Want to nominate a TA as "TA of the Year"? Send an email to dus\@stat.duke.edu with your nomination. ::: ## AE 19 - Last one! ::: question - Go to your `ae` repo, and pull. - Make a change, any change, to `ae-19-last-ae.qmd`. render, commit, and push. ::: ## Announcements - Finalize (render, commit, push) by 8 am tomorrow (Wednesday) morning - Fill out last peer evaluations by Sunday # Awards ## People's Choice - Honorable Mentions - Section 1 - Green Beans - Forest Fires: - Section 3 - Team E - Red Wine Quality: - Section 5 - Inside Investigators - NYC Crime: Perpetrator Demographics & Crime by Borough: ## People's Choice üèÜ Section 2 - Data Devils - Gender Pay Gap by Industry: ![](images/data-devils.png) ## Most commits to project - Honorable mentions ![](images/most-commits/HM.png){fig-align="center"} ## Most commits to project üèÜ ![](images/most-commits/W-caroline-metz.png){fig-align="center"} ## Most activity on Ed - Honorable mentions ![](images/most-ed-activity/HM.png){fig-align="center"} ## Most activity on Ed üèÜ ![](images/most-ed-activity/W-Alison-Jang.png){fig-align="center"} ## Best ugly plot - Honorable mentions ::: columns ::: {.column width="33%"} Gigi Dunn ![](images/ugly-plots/HM-gigi-dunn.png){fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} Erica Shen ![](images/ugly-plots/HM-erica-shen.png){fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} Harika Amineni ![](images/ugly-plots/HM-harika-amineni.png){fig-align="center"} ::: ::: ## Best ugly plot üèÜ Lina Leyhausen ![](images/ugly-plots/W-lina-leyhausen.png){fig-align="center"} # Shiny {.nostretch} ![](images/hex-shiny.png){fig-align="center" width="30%"} ## Shiny > Shiny is an R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R. > You can host standalone apps on a webpage or embed them in R Markdown documents or build dashboards. > You can also extend your Shiny apps with CSS themes, htmlwidgets, and JavaScript actions. ## Shiny App
::: columns ::: {.column .larger width="40%"} Server ::: {style="border: 2px solid; border-radius: 5px; text-align:center; font-size: 90px; height: 250px"} ``{=html} + ``{=html} ::: ::: ::: {.column width="20%"} ::: {style="text-align: center; font-size: 90px; padding-top: 20px"}
‚áÑ ::: ::: ::: {.column .larger width="40%"} Client / Browser ::: {style="border: 2px solid; border-radius: 5px; text-align: center; height: 250px"} ::: {style="font-size: 90px"} ``{=html} ::: ::: {style="font-size: 50px"} ``{=html} + ``{=html} + ``{=html} ::: ::: ::: ::: ## Anatomy of an App ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|3-11|4-6|8-10"} library(shiny) shinyApp( ui = list( # new (to you) widgets go here ), server = function(input, output, session) { # somewhat familiat (to you) code goes here } ) ``` ::: ## Shiny Widgets Gallery ::: {style="text-align: center"} ::: ## A brief widget tour ::: {style="text-align: center"} [rundel.shinyapps.io/widgets/](https://rundel.shinyapps.io/widgets/) ::: ## Live demo Let's make a weather app! Go to to follow along. ::: callout-note If you want to code along, click on the "Use this template" button to create a copy of this repo for yourself, clone it in RStudio, and code along as usual. :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
